alert.note: Alert for Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 2:48PM CST until March 03 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EST FOR SOUTHWESTERN HAWKINS...SOUTH CENTRAL HANCOCK...JEFFERSON... NORTHWESTERN COCKE...WEST CENTRAL GREENE...CENTRAL GRAINGER...NORTH CENTRAL SEVIER AND HAMBLEN COUNTIES... At 347 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Jefferson City, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Jefferson City, Dandridge, Rutledge, Bean Station, White Pine, New Market, Baneberry, Russellville and Mosheim. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 409 and 428. Interstate 81 in Tennessee between mile markers 1 and 24. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for east Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
